results.title: It’s Official: The Leap Second Will Be Retired (a Decade from Now)
results.abstract: On Friday, an international vote was taken to ditch the leap second, a technical fudge that has caused headaches since its inception 50 years ago.
org_facet: International Bureau of Weights and Measures
National Institute of Standards and Technology

media.caption: Clock faces at the Electric Time Company in Medfield, Mass. The leap second was devised as a way to align the atomic time scale, in use since 1967 and derived from the vibration of cesium atoms, with the slightly slower time kept by Earth as it rotates.
